version.author: guonaudio
version.changelog: Added undo/redo to client, and ability to control undo/redo (as well as for group)

version.author: guonaudio
version.changelog: Throw error if ReaWwise is not installed

reapack.name: ReaWwiseHelper_Delete Objects With Temp Prefix.lua
reapack.desc: Wwise Delete Objects with Temp Prefix

reapack.name: ReaWwiseHelper_Print Sounds in Actor-Mixer Hierarchy.lua
reapack.desc: Wwise Print Sounds in Actor-Mixer Hierarchy

metadata.description:
{\rtf1\ansi\deff0{\fonttbl{\f0 \fswiss Helvetica;}{\f1 \fmodern Courier;}} {\colortbl;\red255\green0\blue0;\red0\green0\blue255;} \widowctrl\hyphauto
{\pard \ql \f0 \sa180 \li0 \fi0 \outlinelevel0 \b \fs36 ReaWwise Helper\par} {\pard \ql \f0 \sa180 \li0 \fi0 A simple library to OOP-ify the ReaWwise bindings for Lua.\par} {\pard \ql \f0 \sa180 \li0 \fi0 The code below is provided verbatim from the blog post {\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "https://www.audiokinetic.com/en/blog/waapi-in-reascript-lua-with-reawwise/"}}{\fldrslt{\ul WAAPI in ReaScript Lua with ReaWwise }}} . The purpose of the script is to output the paths of several objects selected in Wwise.\par} {\pard \ql \f0 \sa180 \li0 \fi0 \f1 if(reaper.AK_Waapi_Connect("127.0.0.1", 8080)) then\line local fieldsToReturn = reaper.AK_AkJson_Array()\line \line reaper.AK_AkJson_Array_Add(fieldsToReturn, reaper.AK_AkVariant_String("path"))\line \line local options = reaper.AK_AkJson_Map()\line reaper.AK_AkJson_Map_Set(options, "return", fieldsToReturn)\line \line local result = reaper.AK_Waapi_Call("ak.wwise.ui.getSelectedObjects",\line reaper.AK_AkJson_Map(), options)\line \line local status = reaper.AK_AkJson_GetStatus(result)\line \line if(status) then\line local objects = reaper.AK_AkJson_Map_Get(result, "objects")\line local numObjects = reaper.AK_AkJson_Array_Size(objects)\line \line for i=0, numObjects - 1 do\line local item = reaper.AK_AkJson_Array_Get(objects, i)\line local path = reaper.AK_AkJson_Map_Get(item, "path")\line local pathStr = reaper.AK_AkVariant_GetString(path)\line reaper.ShowConsoleMsg(pathStr .. "\\n")\line end\line end\line \line reaper.AK_AkJson_ClearAll()\line reaper.AK_Waapi_Disconnect()\line end\par} {\pard \ql \f0 \sa180 \li0 \fi0 Using the ReaWwise Helper library, the code can instead be condensed to the following:\par} {\pard \ql \f0 \sa180 \li0 \fi0 \f1 local client <close> = WaapiClient()\line if client then\line local returns = "path"\line local parameters = JsonMap("return", JsonArray(returns))\line \line local isValid, result = client:Call("ak.wwise.ui.getSelectedObjects", JsonMap(), parameters)\line \line if isValid then\line local objects = result:GetJsonMapTable("objects")\line for _, object in pairs(objects) do\line reaper.ShowConsoleMsg(object:GetString(returns))\line end\line end\line end\par} }
